definition: to come back from death's door (idiom); unexpected rescue from danger/fig. to recover from a seemingly impossible situation/to find a way out of a predicament
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: He was unexpectedly rescued from the desert.
sentences.chinese: 他絕處逢生，從沙漠被救了回來。

sentences.english: Xiaoping always has luck and ability to be unexpected rescued from a desperate situation.
sentences.chinese: 小萍從來有絕處逢生的本領和運氣。

sentences.english: Desperate villagers who tried to force their way into the towns were greeted with machine-gun fire .
sentences.chinese: 以爲逃到城鎮可以絕處逢生的農民被機槍掃射。

sentences.english: Ah, don't you understand the reason of be unexpected rescued from a desperate situation?
sentences.chinese: 呵呵，難道你不明白絕處逢生的道理嗎？

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
hoodlum/bad guy
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to uphold virtue and condemn evil (idiom)
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
selfless/impartial
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: flying squirrel/(dialect) bat
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
talented field commander (military)
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
